summary: Throne of Glass Characters as John Mulaney Quotes
title: Throne of Glass Characters as John Mulaney Quotes
body:
Aelin: I’m sorry about last night. It’s just that I’m mean and loud. It will probably happen again.

Rowan:  I would not say that, not even as a joke that my wife is a bitch and I don’t like her. That is not true. My wife is a bitch and I like her so much.

Dorian: Woah! That tall child looks terrible! Get some rest tall child! You can’t keep burning the candle at both ends!

Manon: Every new song is about how “Tonight is the night” and how “We only have tonight.” That’s such 19 year old garbage.

Chaol: In personal news let’s talk about my dad.

Yrene: “I think Emily Dickinson’s a lesbian.”

Aedion: none of us really know our fathers… ANYWAY

Lysandra: In terms of like, instant relief, canceling plans is like heroin.

Elide: I am very small, and I have no money so you can imagine the kind of stress I’m under.

Lorcan: I also don’t want me to be doing what I’m doing.

|| YA Books as John Mulaney || SOC || The Lunar Chronicles || ACOTAR || TOG|| The Cruel Prince || Wicked Saints ||

Literally just a fan of fantasy and Sci-Fi (and YA-novels). Currently reading: Kingdom of Ash (SO. MUCH. PAIN.) & Luck in the Shadows

Thanks for checking by!

tags: i am celaena sardothien and i will not be afraid
summary:
‘I don’t think you realize who you’re dealing with.’ 
The man clicked his tongue. 'If you were that good, you would be more than...
text:
‘I don’t think you realize who you’re dealing with.’
The man clicked his tongue. 'If you were that good, you would be more than Captain of the Guard.’
Chaol let out a low, breathy laugh. 'I wasn’t talking about me.’
'She’s just one girl.’
Though his guts were twisting at the thought of her in this place, with these people, though he was considering every possible way to get himself and Celaena out of here alive, he gave the man a grin. 'Then you’re really in for a surprise.’
source:
Crown of Midnight, Sarah J. Maas

Rereading the Throne of Glass series to get ready for the Kingdom of Ash release THIS MONTH! Crown of Midnight is making me remember why I like Chaol…

reblog.comment:
Crown of Midnight, Sarah J. Maas

Rereading the Throne of Glass series to get ready for the Kingdom of Ash release THIS MONTH! Crown of Midnight is making me remember why I like Chaol…

summary: "She would tuck Sam into her heart, a bright light for her to take out whenever things were darkest. And then she would remember...
body:
“She would tuck Sam into her heart, a bright light for her to take out whenever things were darkest. And then she would remember how it had felt to be loved, when the world had held nothing but possibility. No matter what they did to her, they could never take that away. She would not break”

-Celeana Sardothien, the assassin’s blade.

reblog.comment:

-Celeana Sardothien, the assassin’s blade.

body:
What if …

… Aelin is pregnant while she gets tortured?

Cause I can’t remember that she took a potion to prevent it.

What if she lays pregnant in that iron coffin?

In that case Maeve tortured not only Aelin but also the unborn child of Rowan and Aelin …

summary: I looked through my TBR and realised that I have a lot of October releases there, in fact I have 9 books that are released in...
body:
I looked through my TBR and realised that I have a lot of October releases there, in fact I have 9 books that are released in October. Oh, the perils of being a book blogger!

Without further ado here’s my list of October releases I’m excited for –

October 2nd – 

Grim Lovelies – This book had me at ‘enchanted from animal to human girl’. Set in Paris this is Megan Shepherd’s debut and I can’t wait to get my hands on it.

Muse of Nightmares – I read Strange The Dreamer at the start of this year and have been anxiously awaiting the final book of the duology!

October 4th –

Dry – I got a sampler of this from YALC and it instantly went on by TBR. The taps run dry in a drought and chaos ensues.

Sawkill Girls – I love this cover! Scary stories, a ravenous evil and female power. I’m so up for this.

The Boneless Mercies  – Women are hired to kill quickly, and they hear of a monster slaughtering innocents. I hope this is as exciting as it sounds.

The Way Past Winter – A brother is stolen away and the sisters must travel North in a bid to save him. It sounds like a fairytale-esque book that I’ll adore.

October 9th – 

Beneath the Citadel – Ancient prophecies that came to pass, and a group of friends who uncover the mystery behind it. Sounds like the fantasy I always love.

18th October –

Distortion – Having read Ascension a few months ago and loving it (my review is here). I’ve been eagerly awaiting the next book, I want to know what happens!

October 23rd – 

Kingdom of Ash – This one doesn’t need any introduction. I’m excited and scared for this book.

There you have it. Some of the books that I’m excited for October release, I feel that for me it’s a good mix of genres, but monsters seem to be an over-arching theme. Perfect for these dark evenings!

I took a look through my TBR and picked out my most anticipated October releases. Featuring the likes of Sawkill Girls and The Way Past Winter October looks like it’ll be an exciting month! I looked through my TBR and realised that I have a lot of October releases there, in fact I have 9 books that are released in October.

tags: a court of thorns and roses
summary: Im glad I’m not alone in not wanting ACOTAR to become a movie.
body:
Im glad I’m not alone in not wanting ACOTAR to become a movie.

I honestly don’t think I’ll go see it. I might just avoid trailers, teasers and the whole dang feature of it.


After seeing the train wreck Twilight was and every other book to movie, I DO NOT TRUST HOLLYWOOD TO NOT SCREW THIS UP AND TAINT IT.


Twilight has become such a joke because of the movies, when some of the books were actually very enjoyable.


Uurggh, just leave it alone. 😫

blog.description:
Sarah J. Mass Book Blog

Header: @ladyhavilliard

(go follow her)

title: Love Letter to Aspiring Artists
body:
To me the only difference between ‘great art’ and ‘ordinary art’ is that the ‘great art’ was loved by many people. You may feel your art is ‘bad’ or ‘not good enough’ but with practice you can become great. You don’t give yourself enough credit for the art you make. I appreciate your art no matter how messy, sketchy, or odd, it may look to you because, art is all about sharing ideas. Even if your sketch, drawing, painting, or anything else you create doesn’t look the way it does in your head you put in the effort. Usually, I can tell what you might have been thinking and fall in love with the idea and expression, not just what’s on the surface. Keep creating, keep expressing your ideas because, someday you could create something great to share with the world.

Love, 

            Shadows

This book will be the dead of me, though three quotes on one day also did a pretty great job for that!

blog.name: thebraxiatelcollection
blog.title: Torture and Interior Design
blog.description:
Owned and managed by Irving Braxiatel himself, the Braxiatel Collection is arguably the finest and most extensive collection in the known universe. 'Collection of what?' is an invalid question. It is a collection of everything.
Greetings, my name is April and this is my little Collection of everything.
My blog has the official approval of Miles Richardson. (15/09/2016).
Previously known as songofgallifrey.
